mdRecord.dcterms:title: An abridgment of the common law: being a collection of the principal cases argued and adjudged in the several courts of Westminster-hall. The whole being digested in a clear and alphabetical method under proper heads, with several divisions and numbers under each title .. whereby the opinion and judgment of the courts may be seen in an exact series of time, and what alterations have been made in the law by subsequent statutes and judgments, brought down to the year 1725 / By William Nelson
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Nelson, William, 1653-
mdRecord.dcterms:description: SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Included in the 1828 catalogue of the University of Virginia Library.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Law--Great Britain.
Law
